info.title: OTData API
info.description:
The software-independent standard interface for the transmission of telematics data.
- The authentication is specified by the interface operator
- It is recommended to use OAuth 2.0

hostname.description: Self-hosted Enterprise Server or Enterprise Cloud hostname

tags.name: Tour Management
tags.description: Endpoints to manage tours and their belonging drives

get.summary: Returns a list of the latest live data
get.description:
Filter search: ``customer_id``, ``device_id``, ``vehicle_id``, ``vehicle_group_id``, ``tour_id`` and ``drive_id``

Cursor-based pagination: ``cursor`` and ``limit``

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Specifies if just a selection of fields should be returned

get.summary: Returns a list of history of live data
get.description:
Filter search: ``customer_id``, ``device_id``, ``vehicle_id``, ``vehicle_group_id``, ``tour_id`` and ``drive_id``

Time selection: ``from`` and ``to``

Cursor-based pagination: ``cursor`` and ``limit``

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Specifies if just a selection of fields should be returned

get.summary: Returns a specific live data resource
Returns a list of the latest ETAs
Returns a list of history of ETAs
Returns a list of tacho files

parameters.name: used_time
parameters.description: Indicates to which time tags `from` and `to` refer: ``activity`` refers to the time the activities were stored in the tacho files, ``download`` refers to the download time of the tacho file ``data`` refers to the time stemp of the tacho files

201.description: Created. The request has been fulfilled and has resulted in one or more new resources being created.

get.summary: Returns a list of logs that matches the specified time intervall
get.description:
If `from` and `to` do not exist, all logs are returned.
All logs up to `loglevel` are returned.

post.summary: Creates a tour and optionally its subresources

get.summary: Returns a list of tour events
Returns a list of drive events

Creates a subscription to an event

otid.description: Registered OpenTelematics ID of the requester

api_version.description: Version of the OpenTelematics API used, e.g.:`"2.0.0"`

api_version.name: api-version
api_version.description: Version of the OpenTelematics API used, e.g.:`"2.0.0"`

from.name: from
from.description: Only data from this point on are returned

to.name: to
to.description: Only data up to this point in time are returned

otid.name: otid
otid.description: Registered OpenTelematics ID of the requester

cursor.name: cursor
cursor.description: Cursor for cursor-based pagination. Use ``next_cursor`` from response body to get the next page.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: The limit parameter sets a maximum number of results to return per call.

embedRequired.name: embed
embedRequired.description: Whether subresources should be embedded in the response

if_none_match.name: If-None-Match
if_none_match.description: Newest known entity tag of the resource as defined by [RFC7232](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7232#section-3.2)

if_match.name: If-Match
if_match.description: Newest known entity tag of the resource as defined by [RFC7232](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7232#section-3.1)

tour_uri_query.name: tour_uri
tour_uri_query.description: URI of the tour the event refers to

drive_uri_query.name: drive_uri
drive_uri_query.description: URI of the drive the event refers to

task_uri_query.name: task_uri
task_uri_query.description: URI of the task the event refers to

resource_uri_query.name: resource_uri
resource_uri_query.description: URI of the resource the event refers to

NoContent.description: No Content. The server has successfully fulfilled the request and there is no additional content to return in the response payload body

NotModified.description: Not Modified. The resource has not been modified since the version specified by the request header If-None-Match.

BadRequest.description: Bad Request. The server cannot or will not process the request, due to a client error.

Unauthorized.description: Unauthorized. The request requires user authentication.

Forbidden.description:
Forbidden. The server understood the request, but refuses to authorize
it.

NotFound.description:
Not Found. The server has not found anything matching the effective
request URI.

PreconditionFailed.description: Precondition Failed. One or more conditions (e.g. If-None-Match header) given in the request header fields evaluated to false when tested on the server.

UnsupportedMediaType.description: Unsupported Media Type. The origin server is refusing to service the request because the payload is in a format not supported by this method on the target resource.

PreconditionRequired.description: Precondition Required. The origin server requires the request to be conditional.

InternalServerError.description:
Internal Server Error. The server encountered an unexpected condition
which prevented it from fulfilling the request.

schema.description: Depending on the value of ``create_subressources``, subresources will be embedded in the body

type.description: A URI reference that uniquely identifies the problem type only in the context of the provided API. Opposed to the specification in RFC-7807, it is neither recommended to be dereferencable and point to a human-readable documentation nor globally unique for the problem type.

title.description: A short summary of the problem type. Written in English and readable for engineers, usually not suited for non technical stakeholders and not localized.

status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: A human readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem that is helpful to locate the problem and give advice on how to proceed. Written in English and readable for engineers, usually not suited for non technical stakeholders and not localized.

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem, e.g. by adding a fragment identifier or sub-path to the problem type. May be used to locate the root of this problem in the source code.

characteristic.description:
`satellite`: GPS, Galileo, GLONASS etc.
`indirect`: Bluetooth, Wi-Fi etc.

address_type.description:
Type to distinguish between different types of addresses, so that
you can have several addresses in one list

addition.description: Further address information or additional details

ismandatory.description: Indicates if it is mandatory to notify

value.description: Rotational speed of engine in rpm

items.description: Fuel level primary, secondary, ... tank in %

value.description: Wet tank air pressure in kPa
Fuel used at cruise in liter
Fuel used at drive in liter
Number of idle longer than 5 min
Number of idle longer than 10 min
Time engine is on in sec
Total vehicle distance with cruise control

Tacho.description:
`workingstate`, `timerelstate`, `cardpresent`, `overspeed`,
`systemevent`, `direction` and `speed` are described and specified as in
SAE J 1939

workstate.description: State of work of the drivers

timerelstate.description:
Indicates if the driver approaches or exceeds working time limits
0=normal / 1=15 min. bef. 4 1/2h / 2=4 1/2h reached / 3=15 min bef. 9h / 4=9h reached / 5=15min bef. 16h / 6=16h reached / 14=Error / 15=n/a

cardpresent.description: Indicates the presence of a driver card

overspeed.description:
Indicates whether the vehicle is exceeding the legal speed limit set
in the tachograph

systemevent.description:
Indicates that a tachograph event has occurred. This may include
power supply interruption, interruption of the speed sensor,
incorrect data on the driver card, driving without a driver card,
illegal removal of a driver card, insertion of a driver card during
driving, and time adjustment

direction.description: Indicates the direction of the vehicle

speed.description: Speed of the vehicle registered by the tachograph

cruisetime2.description: Total cruise time w/o acceleration pedal in sec.

cruisedistance2.description: Total cruise distance w/o acceleration pedal in km

axel.description: axle number front to back beginning with 0

time_window.description: Estimated time window from the given ``eta`` and confidence level

confidence_level.description: Confidence level for the given ``time_window`` in percent

drive_number.description: Indicates the position of the drive in a tour

adr_totals.description:
Summarized information about the dangerous goods that are present
during the drive. May be different for each drive.

uri.description: URI structure is depending on the ``event_type``

status.description:
Information about the status of an item e.g. the condition at
delivery

tour_links.description: List of URIs of tours to which the shipment is linked, respectively tours with tasks linked to this shipment.

addresses.description: All addresses relevant for the shipment

items.description: List of all single items of the shipment

parentid.description:
Item ID of the package the item is part of (e.g. the ID of the
palette to which the item belongs). With the `parentid` you are able
to map any tree structure in the item list.

codes.description: List of codes on the item, e.g. barcodes

type.description: Type to distinguish between different types of codes

scanrequired.description: Indicates if the item must be scanned

adrinfo.description:
Information on classification according to the 'Agreement concerning
the International Carriage of Dangerous Goods by Road' (ADR).
Summarized information on the dangerous goods present on each drive
can be found in `Drive`

shipment_link.description: URI of the shipment the task refers to

company_card.description: The company card which was used

data.description: container data bytes encoded in Base64

Timestamp.description: Creation time of the data set
